result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel P. Odonnell

defendant.name: Odonnell, Daniel P.
defendant.address: 1209 West River Drive, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel P. Odonnell in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:41 pm  Court calls the case and states the appearances.
Cases heard are 16CM114, 16CM154 and 16CM95.
This matter is set for a plea today.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Court questions Atty Halverson re: Defendant's capability to proceed.
Atty Halverson responds.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest for 16CM114 - Count 1 and 16CM154 - Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CM154: Count 1 - Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CM114: Count 1 - Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CM95: Dismissed and read in

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Defendant.
Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:
16CM114
Count 1: 
Sentence is withheld.
Placed on Probation 12 months.
Early discharge after 6 months if complied with all conditions and agent recommends it.
Take all prescribed medications, only as prescribed.
Sign all necessary releases.
Continue to engage in mental health counseling and treatment.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Pay costs.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit a DNA sample.

16CM154
Count 1:  
Serve 115 days jail, credit for 115 days - time served sentence
Pay costs.
Pay DNA Surcharge.

Both cases may be expunged upon payment of court costs in 16CM154 and upon successful completion of probation in 16CM114, that may be expunged as well. 

20 days to appeal the case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Record Update

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
original filed in 16CM154
**received by BR 3 Judge on 07/22/16 and filed in COC office on 07/25/16
Status conference on August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel P. Odonnell in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Daniel P. Odonnell in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CM-154, 16CM-114 and 16CM-95.

3:32 PM Court call cases.
Court states appearances.

Defendant has been returned to Court after being found incompetent. Defendant was committed to Dept of Health Services.
Defendant was also on a waiting list for one of the patient treatment facilities.
Court received a report from Mendota, indicating in their opinion that Defendant is competent to proceed.

Each counsel received a copy of this report.

971.14(5)c is referred to. 

Defendant claims to be competent.
Court questions Atty Halverson.

Both parties are willing to accept Dr. M.'s report into evidence without testimony.

Court receives the report.

Neither counsel are presenting evidence.
Neither party are objecting to findings.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds that Defendant to be competent and will be discharged from the committment that was previously entered in this Court. Criminal proceedings can be resumed at this time.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court.
Atty Halverson addresses the Court, requests more time.

Atty Halverson requests the bond in 16CM-154 be amended to a signature bond and other bonds be reinstated. 

Court questions Atty Halverson for clarifications.

Defendant's mother is present. 
Court questions Ms. Odonnell.
Ms. Odonnell addresses the Court.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding the request for bond modifications, will defer to the Court.
Atty Halverson responds.

Court addresses the parties as to next court date.

BY THE COURT:
16CM-154:
Bond amended to $1,000 signature bond 
comply with all conditions set forth in other bonds
day report 7 times per week
comply wtih all treatment recommendat from physicians and psychiatrist
take all medications as prescribed by physicians and psychiatrists
comply with any and all other conditions previously set 
reside with parents
father update the safety plan within the next 48 hours  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ TTF 07/14/16
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED BY THE COURT that the defendant be transported and admitted into a mental health institution designated by the Department of Health Services FORTHWITH /s/ TTF 06/10/16
Stipulation to Modify Conditions of Bond
Affidavit of Atty Acalia Halverson
Motion for Transport Forthwith filed by Atty Acalia Halverson
Transcript of Competency Hearing held on April 12, 2016 **Testimony of Dr Michael Galli
Atty Acalia Halverson appointed
#1  Report of Competency Evaluation from Dr Galli dated 04/07/16 (CONFIDENTIAL)
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) /s/ TTF 04/12/16
Order is signed by the Court -  (credit 18 days).
records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
11:08 a.m. Defendant Daniel P. Odonnell in court with attorney Ryan Drengler and Atty Halverson. Defendant Daniel P. Odonnell in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CM95 and 16CM114 and 16CM154 are all heard for  Competency Hearing. Exhibit P#1 is marked prior to Court. Parties received and reviewed the evaluation.  Atty Drengler informs the Court that the Defendant request new public defender and Atty Halverson is present today. Court grants Atty Drengler is replaced by Atty Halverson.
11:18 a.m. ADA Cousins calls expert witness, Dr. M. Galli, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
No cross exam.
BTC:*****Court finds probable cause in all three complaints and that the Defendant incompetent at this time but is probable that he could be restored to competency.
Competency examination from Dr Galli dated April 7, 2016
Competency hearing on April 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
filed by the State

$1,000 sig bond: Amended.  03-10-15**Day report is eliminated from the bond.***Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  D. O'Donnell  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

***Family Safety Plan filed by Daniel J O'Donnell on 02/17/16:
I want contact with the defendant and I am filing this document as required byu the Court order for contact to be allowed as stated in the bond condition

8:55 a.m. Defendant Daniel P. Odonnell in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant as to his attorney.  Clerk notes Atty Drengler was appointed to the case on 03-08-16. Clerk calls Public Defender office.
9:03 a.m. Court in short recess. Parents of the Defendant have concerns with their home setting.
10:13 a.m. Back in session. Atty Drengler is present now.  No objection to outpatient competency evaluation.
Court states if there are problems, Court can order a cash bond and the evaluation would be done inpatient.

BTC: Competency Examination is ordered.
Court signs order. Clerk will send to examiner.

Court reviews the complaint and finds 
ADA Cousins request to Amend the bond to eliminate Day Report to 7 days a week.

BTC: Court amends the sig bond to eliminate the Day Report condition.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Competency evaluation due date scheduled for April 11, 2016.
filed by Atty Ryan Drengler
